Agile Software Development, Principles, Patterns, and Practices, by Robert
C. Martin:
http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0135974445/002-2470244-0838428
?vi=glance

Chapter 3 has a dialog between Bob Koss and Bob Martin doing test driven
development of a bowling scoring program from start to finish.  It's
brilliant.  It shows the errors and dead ends they go down in the beginning,
but as they write the tests first they gradually get a very simple, fully
tested, fully functioning, even well refactored program.

This is the best book on software engineering I have read.

Scott Stirling

> Can anyone point me towards a book that give some practical insights into

> tests?
>
